revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=ipTIME |model=N8004R |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date=12/2011 |fcc_date= |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Zioncom |manuf_model=IP04176 |manuf_rev= |availability=Korea only |type=wireless router |fcc_id= |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Realtek |cpu1_model=RTL8198 |cpu1_cspeed=500 |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L3206EM2I-12G |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=H5PS5162GFR-S5C |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial=yes,, populated,, 4-pin header,, (38400,8,N,1) |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model=RTL8192DR |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi2_chip1_model=RTL8192CE |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips= |flags=boot log |stock_boot=rtkload; |stock_os=Linux;2.6.30.9; |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid=iptime,iptime5G |default_ssid_regex=^iptime$,,,^iptime5G$ |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:26:66 |oui_eth=00:26:66 }} "04176C" is silkscreened on the board. It is presumed this device is a '''Zioncom''' IP04176 (though it could potentially be a IP04173). [http://koreatechblog.com/wireless/iptime-n5004-vs-n8004r-wireless-router-speed-test-compare/ Speed comparison with the N5004 on http://koreatechblog.com] :''ipTime N8004R using RealTek RTL8198 chip introduced December 2011 W94,000'' :''is an enhanced version of N8004 using RaLink RT3662 chip introduced July 2011'' [http://www.iptime.co.kr/~iptime/bbs/view.php?id=qna&page=6&ffid=&fsid=&dffid=&dfsid=&dftid=&sn1=&divpage=6&dis_comp=&sn=off&ss=on&sc=on&select_arrange=headnum&desc=asc&no=326127 Q+A on the ipTIME site showing SoCs used by various ipTIME routers, including this one] It is assumed this device uses RTL8192DR (/ RTL8192DE .. any difference?) and RTL8192CE. [http://www.iptime.co.kr/~iptime/prd.php?pf=3&page=&pt=149&pd=3 Per the ipTIME website], this device has 4MB Flash and 64MB RAM. :Per the below serial dump, the PCI IDs for the radios are 10ec:8193 (default 92DE ID) and 10ec:8191 (88CE ID per the pci-id repo). [http://wandoli.blogspot.com/2012/09/iptime-n8004r.html Additional internal images (KR)] [http://funfunhan.com/2473212 Review on funfunhan.com (KR)] :The power adapter shown is a '''Shen Zhen City Hong Ben ELectronic Co., Ltd''' HB12B-050250SPA (5V, 2.5A). The same parent '''Zioncom''' product may also be sold as the [[TOTOLINK N500RDG]]. ==Images== Image:ipTIME_N8004R_angled_front.jpg|angled front Image:ipTIME_N8004R_angled_front_2.jpg|angled front 2 Image:ipTIME_N8004R_angled_top.jpg|angled top Image:ipTIME_N8004R_angled_bottom.jpg|angled bottom Image:ipTIME_N8004R_angled_back_ports.jpg|angled back (ports) Image:ipTIME_N8004R_dimensions.jpg|dimensions Image:ipTIME_N8004R_with_box_and_stuff.jpg|box and stuff [[Has images::external| ]] Image:ipTIME_N8004R_board_top.JPG|board top Image:ipTIME_N8004R_RTL8198.JPG|RTL8198 SoC Image:ipTIME_N8004R_UART_ICE_Flash.JPG|UART, ICE, and Flash Image:ipTIME_N8004R_RAM.JPG|RAM Image:ipTIME_N8004R_power.JPG|power section Image:ipTIME_N8004R_power2.JPG|power section 2 Image:ipTIME_N8004R_capacitors.JPG|alt view of caps Image:ipTIME_N8004R_Zioncom_ID.JPG|Zioncom board ID Image:ipTIME_N8004R_Eth_label.JPG|Ethernet MAC label Image:ipTIME_N8004R_LED_silkscreen.JPG|LED silkscreen Image:ipTIME_N8004R_board_bot.JPG|board bottom Image:ipTIME_N8004R_board_bot_subsection.JPG|board bottom, subsection [[Has images::internal| ]] Image:ipTIME_N8004R_top.JPG|top Image:ipTIME_N8004R_top_logo.JPG|top logo Image:ipTIME_N8004R_LED_panel.JPG|LED panel Image:ipTIME_N8004R_LED_legend.JPG|LED legend Image:ipTIME_N8004R_back_panel_no_bottom.JPG|back panel, bottom off Image:ipTIME_N8004R_back_power.JPG|back panel, power ipTIME_N8004R_label_side.JPG|label side [[Has images::label| ]] ==Serial== ===Pinout=== Obviously, the UART pins are located @ the header clearly labeled '''UART'''. Pinout seems to be... 
(3.3) (TxD) (RxD) (GND)

   |
   | -----------> to SPI Flash
   |
   v
to JTAG / ICE
